trans-unit.source: Create, monitor, and manage Azure data factories by using Data Factory SDK
trans-unit.target: Create, monitor, and manage Azure data factories by using Data Factory SDK

trans-unit.source: Learn how to programmatically create, monitor, and manage Azure data factories by using Data Factory SDK.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to programmatically create, monitor, and manage Azure data factories by using Data Factory SDK.

trans-unit.source: Create, monitor, and manage Azure data factories using Data Factory .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: Create, monitor, and manage Azure data factories using Data Factory .NET SDK

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: You can create, monitor, and manage Azure data factories programmatically using Data Factory .NET SDK.
trans-unit.target: You can create, monitor, and manage Azure data factories programmatically using Data Factory .NET SDK.

trans-unit.source: This article contains a walkthrough that you can follow to create a sample .NET console application that creates and monitors a data factory.
trans-unit.target: This article contains a walkthrough that you can follow to create a sample .NET console application that creates and monitors a data factory.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Data Factory Class Library Reference[adf-class-library-reference]</linkText><title></title></link> for details about Data Factory .NET SDK.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Data Factory Class Library Reference[adf-class-library-reference]</linkText><title></title></link> for details about Data Factory .NET SDK.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2012 or 2013
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2012 or 2013

trans-unit.source: Download and install <link><linkText>Azure .NET SDK[azure-developer-center]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: Download and install <link><linkText>Azure .NET SDK[azure-developer-center]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Download and install NuGet packages for Azure Data Factory.
trans-unit.target: Download and install NuGet packages for Azure Data Factory.

trans-unit.source: Instructions are in the walkthrough.
trans-unit.target: Instructions are in the walkthrough.

trans-unit.source: Walkthrough
trans-unit.target: Walkthrough

trans-unit.source: Using Visual Studio 2012 or 2013, create a C# .NET console application.
trans-unit.target: Using Visual Studio 2012 or 2013, create a C# .NET console application.

trans-unit.source: Launch
trans-unit.target: Launch

trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2012

trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2013

trans-unit.target: Click

trans-unit.target: File

trans-unit.target: , point to

trans-unit.target: New

trans-unit.target: Expand

trans-unit.target: Templates

trans-unit.target: , and select

trans-unit.source: Visual C#
trans-unit.target: Visual C#

trans-unit.source: . In this walkthrough, you use C#, but you can use any .NET language.
trans-unit.target: . In this walkthrough, you use C#, but you can use any .NET language.

trans-unit.target: Select

trans-unit.target: Console Application

trans-unit.source: from the list of project types on the right.
trans-unit.target: from the list of project types on the right.

trans-unit.target: Enter

trans-unit.source: DataFactoryAPITestApp
trans-unit.target: DataFactoryAPITestApp

trans-unit.target: for the

trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.target: Select

trans-unit.source: C:\ADFGetStarted
trans-unit.target: C:\ADFGetStarted

trans-unit.source: for the
trans-unit.target: for the

trans-unit.source: Location
trans-unit.target: Location

trans-unit.source: Click
trans-unit.target: Click

trans-unit.source: OK
trans-unit.target: OK

trans-unit.source: to create the project.
trans-unit.target: to create the project.

trans-unit.source: Click <html></html>Tools<html></html>, point to <html></html>NuGet Package Manager<html></html>, and click <html></html>Package Manager Console<html></html>.
trans-unit.target: Click <html></html>Tools<html></html>, point to <html></html>NuGet Package Manager<html></html>, and click <html></html>Package Manager Console<html></html>.

trans-unit.source: In the <html></html>Package Manager Console<html></html>, execute the following commands one-by-one.<html></html>.
trans-unit.target: In the <html></html>Package Manager Console<html></html>, execute the following commands one-by-one.<html></html>.

trans-unit.source: Add the following appSetttings section to the App.config file.
trans-unit.target: Add the following appSetttings section to the App.config file.

trans-unit.source: These are used by the helper method: GetAuthorizationHeader.
trans-unit.target: These are used by the helper method: GetAuthorizationHeader.

trans-unit.source: Replace values for SubscriptionId and ActiveDirectoryTenantId with your Azure subscription and tenant IDs.
trans-unit.target: Replace values for SubscriptionId and ActiveDirectoryTenantId with your Azure subscription and tenant IDs.

trans-unit.source: You can get these values by running Get-AzureAccount from Azure PowerShell (you may need to login first by using Add-AzureAccount).
trans-unit.target: You can get these values by running Get-AzureAccount from Azure PowerShell (you may need to login first by using Add-AzureAccount).

trans-unit.source: Add the following using statements to the source file (Program.cs) in the project.
trans-unit.target: Add the following using statements to the source file (Program.cs) in the project.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code that creates an instance of DataPipelineManagementClient class to the Main method.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code that creates an instance of DataPipelineManagementClient class to the Main method.

trans-unit.source: You will use this object to create a data factory, a linked service, input and output tables, and a pipeline.
trans-unit.target: You will use this object to create a data factory, a linked service, input and output tables, and a pipeline.

trans-unit.source: You will also this object to monitor slices of a table at runtime.
trans-unit.target: You will also this object to monitor slices of a table at runtime.

trans-unit.source: Replace the resourcegroupname with the name of your Azure resource group.
trans-unit.target: Replace the resourcegroupname with the name of your Azure resource group.

trans-unit.source: You can create a resource group using the <link><linkText>New-AzureResourceGroup</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: You can create a resource group using the <link><linkText>New-AzureResourceGroup</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code that creates a data factory to the Main method.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code that creates a data factory to the Main method.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code that creates a linked service to the Main method.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code that creates a linked service to the Main method.

trans-unit.source: Use account name and account key of your Azure storage account for the ConnectionString.
trans-unit.target: Use account name and account key of your Azure storage account for the ConnectionString.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code that creates input and output tables to the Main method.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code that creates input and output tables to the Main method.

trans-unit.source: Note that the FolderPath for the input blob is set to adftutorial/ where adftutorial is the name of the container in your blob storage.
trans-unit.target: Note that the FolderPath for the input blob is set to adftutorial/ where adftutorial is the name of the container in your blob storage.

trans-unit.source: If this container does not exist in your Azure blob storage, create a container with this name: adftutorial and upload a text file to the container.
trans-unit.target: If this container does not exist in your Azure blob storage, create a container with this name: adftutorial and upload a text file to the container.

trans-unit.source: Note that the FolderPath for the output blob is set to: adftutorial/apifactoryoutput/{Slice} where Slice is dynamically calculated based on the value of SliceStart (start date-time of each slice.)
trans-unit.target: Note that the FolderPath for the output blob is set to: adftutorial/apifactoryoutput/{Slice} where Slice is dynamically calculated based on the value of SliceStart (start date-time of each slice.)

trans-unit.source: Add the following code that creates and activates a pipeline to the Main method.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code that creates and activates a pipeline to the Main method.

trans-unit.source: This pipeline has a CopyActivity that takes BlobSource as a source and BlobSink as a sink.
trans-unit.target: This pipeline has a CopyActivity that takes BlobSource as a source and BlobSink as a sink.

trans-unit.source: Add the following helper method used by the Main method to the Program class.
trans-unit.target: Add the following helper method used by the Main method to the Program class.

trans-unit.source: This method pops a dialog box that that lets you provide user name and password that you use to login to Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: This method pops a dialog box that that lets you provide user name and password that you use to login to Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code to the Main method to get the status of a data slice of the output table.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code to the Main method to get the status of a data slice of the output table.

trans-unit.source: There is only slice expected in this sample.
trans-unit.target: There is only slice expected in this sample.

trans-unit.source: (optional) Add the following code to get run details for a data slice slice to the Main method.
trans-unit.target: (optional) Add the following code to get run details for a data slice slice to the Main method.

trans-unit.source: Build the console application.
trans-unit.target: Build the console application.

trans-unit.source: Click Build on the menu and click Build Solution.
trans-unit.target: Click Build on the menu and click Build Solution.

trans-unit.source: If you get an error about ConfigurationManager class, add a reference to the System.Configuration assembly and try to build again.
trans-unit.target: If you get an error about ConfigurationManager class, add a reference to the System.Configuration assembly and try to build again.

trans-unit.source: Confirm that there is at least one file in the adftutorial container in your Azure blob storage.
trans-unit.target: Confirm that there is at least one file in the adftutorial container in your Azure blob storage.

trans-unit.source: If not, create Emp.txt file in Notepad with the following content and upload it to the adftutorial container.
trans-unit.target: If not, create Emp.txt file in Notepad with the following content and upload it to the adftutorial container.

trans-unit.source: Run the sample by clicking Debug -> Start Debugging on the menu.
trans-unit.target: Run the sample by clicking Debug -> Start Debugging on the menu.

trans-unit.source: When you see the Getting run details of a data slice, wait for a few minutes, and press ENTER.
trans-unit.target: When you see the Getting run details of a data slice, wait for a few minutes, and press ENTER.

trans-unit.source: Use the Azure Preview Portal to verify that the data factory: APITutorialFactory is created with the following artifacts:
trans-unit.target: Use the Azure Preview Portal to verify that the data factory: APITutorialFactory is created with the following artifacts:

trans-unit.source: Linked service: LinkedService_AzureStorage
trans-unit.target: Linked service: LinkedService_AzureStorage

trans-unit.source: Tables: TableBlobSource and TableBlobDestination.
trans-unit.target: Tables: TableBlobSource and TableBlobDestination.

trans-unit.source: Pipeline: PipelineBlobSample
trans-unit.target: Pipeline: PipelineBlobSample

trans-unit.source: Verify that an output file is created in the apifactoryoutput folder in the adftutorial container.
trans-unit.target: Verify that an output file is created in the apifactoryoutput folder in the adftutorial container.
